Build: 3.1 M7

I got this in my log after starting up and immediately shutting down. The
refresh polling job should be canceled during shutdown.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.isSynchronized(Resource.java:1129)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.refresh.PollingMonitor.poll(PollingMonitor.java:169)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.refresh.PollingMonitor.run(PollingMonitor.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)
Easy and safe fix.  CCing DJ for fix approval.

Created an attachment (id=21229)
Patch to org.eclipse.core.resources

Proposed fix.  This patch:

 - Makes fields on MonitorManager final (cosmetic fix, the fields are only
assigned in constructor)
 - Cancels the polling job from the stop() method
 - Makes sure polling job checks for cancelation prior to each isSynchronized()
call.
